image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Illinois; born in Winnebago, Minn., March 23, 1925; graduated from Valley City High School, Valley City, N.D.; attended University of Chicago; B.S., George Williams College, 1961; corporate Director of Financial Development, YMCA of Metropolitan Chicago; Illinois State representative, 1973-1977; Illinois State senator, 1977-1985; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-ninth Congress and served until his death on November 15, 1986 (January 3, 1985- November 15, 1986); died on November 15, 1986, in Saint Charles, Ill.; interment in Union Cemetery, Saint Charles, Ill.

asset.name: G000499_001
asset.creditLine: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

researchRecord.name: 1984, 4 commercials on 1 sound tape reel.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during John Grotberg's campaign for the 1984 U.S. congressional election in District 14 of Illinois, Republican Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: 1931-1982, 79.5 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of John Grotberg contain bills, subject files, memos, correspondence, speeches, and campaign material. An inventory is available in the repository.

recordLocation.name: Earl W. Hayter Regional History Center
